author: pieterastra
content:
although stake remains decentralized, doesn't this still threaten chain liveness?
if all blocks are created by a few centralized builders, if any of those go down it would have a big impact on proposed blocks, as proposing validators cannot fall back on building a block themselves anymore. Unless I'm missing something...

author: pieterastra
content:
hmm, interesting. I was thinking about unintended failure (builder downtime) rather than malicious censorship but some of the solutions could overlap, like auxiliary builders. Going to take a closer look later. 
Still won't fix degenerate cases I guess, like having only 3 mega block builders in existence, all on AWS suffering an outage

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Thanks ❤️  Exactly what I was looking for!
